alert.note: Alert for Otsego (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 04 at 8:02PM EDT until August 04 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is still occurring. * WHERE...A portion of central New York, including the following county, Otsego. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 802 PM EDT, Emergency management reported several areas with water over roads especially in Edmeston and Burlington. The heavy rain has ended along with the flash flooding threat and water will be receding over the next several hours. However, several roads in the area remain closed at this time due to high water. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cooperstown, Hartwick, Edmeston, Pittsfield, New Berlin, Milford, Bowerstown, Westville, Burlington, Index, Toddsville, South Edmeston and Lambs Corners. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
